messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] What Decision?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, while Helen s busy, I ll pop in to say, that I was converted to homeschooling by a friend s stack of Home Education Magazines.  I spent a lot of time
messages.messageBody:
>It was never even a question for me. I was homeschooled myself and
>sending our kids to school never crossed my mind. I'll be happy to
>elaborate on that if anyone's interested, but it will have to wait
>until I'm finished editing and proofing our current issue of Home
>Education Magazine, which is supposed to be in the mail to the
>printer in the morning.

Well, while Helen's busy, I'll pop in to say, that I was converted to
homeschooling by a friend's stack of Home Education Magazines. I spent a
lot of time hanging out at this friend's house when my son was an infant.
I spent a lot of time sitting on the couch nursing and reading every word
of the magazines.

Betsy

messages.subject: What Decision?
messages.msgSnippet: ... It was never even a question for me. I was homeschooled myself and sending our kids to school never crossed my mind. I ll be happy to elaborate on that if
messages.messageBody:
At 4:27 PM +0000 5/20/01, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> > I am curious
>> because of another conversation I have been having -- how many of you never
> > sent your kiddos to school and why did you make that decision?

It was never even a question for me. I was homeschooled myself and
sending our kids to school never crossed my mind. I'll be happy to
elaborate on that if anyone's interested, but it will have to wait
until I'm finished editing and proofing our current issue of Home
Education Magazine, which is supposed to be in the mail to the
printer in the morning.

(How's that for a free plug? I can do even better, though. Have you
seen the incredible subscription offer in the current issue of the
Unschooling.com newsletter? It's available at the Unschooling.com
site... and if you've never seen HEM we'll even send you a free
sample no strings issue! Now *that's* a free plug!)

Helen
